dfischer.utils

Class NextProxyConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.NextProxyConfig

  • public class NextProxyConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains configuration data about an external/cascaded HTTP/S proxy server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NextProxyConfig()
      Empty constructor.

      Creates a new instance.
      NextProxyConfig(NextProxyConfig nextProxyConfig)
      Creates a clone.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NextProxyConfig

        public NextProxyConfig()
        Empty constructor. As default the proxy configuration is marked as inactive (no proxy) and the cache of the external/cascaded HTTP proxy server is forced to be disabled.

      • NextProxyConfig

        public NextProxyConfig(NextProxyConfig nextProxyConfig)
        Creates a clone.
        Parameters:
        nextProxyConfig - data to clone

      • NextProxyConfig

        public NextProxyConfig(boolean isActive,
               boolean disableHttpCaching,
               java.lang.String httpHost,
               int httpPort,
               java.lang.String httpsHost,
               int httpsPort,
               java.lang.String base64Auth,
               java.lang.String noNextProxy)
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        isActive - if true, marks the new instance as active
        disableHttpCaching - if true, disables the cache of the HTTP proxy server
        httpHost - hostname or IF address of the HTTP proxy
        httpPort - TCP/IP port number of the HTTP proxy
        httpsHost - hostname or ip address of the HTTPS proxy
        httpsPort - TCP/IP port number of the HTTPS proxy
        base64Auth - base 64 coded username:password for basic authorisation against the proxy server null if no authorisation is needed
        noNextProxy - proxy exclusion list - host names or domain names for which the proxy must not be used. The elements of the list are separated by commas or semicolons

      • NextProxyConfig

        public NextProxyConfig(boolean isActive,
               boolean disableHttpCaching,
               java.lang.String httpHost,
               int httpPort,
               java.lang.String httpsHost,
               int httpsPort,
               java.lang.String base64Auth)
        Deprecated. do not use this constructor
        Old constructor, used for compatibility.

    • Method Detail

      • setActive

        public void setActive()
        Sets the proxy configuration into active state.

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean isActive)
        Sets the proxy configuration into active/inactive state.
        Parameters:
        isActive - true: set to active state, else set to inactive state

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Checks if the proxy configuration is in active state.
        Returns:
        true if the proxy configuration is in active state

      • disableHttpProxyCache

        public void disableHttpProxyCache(boolean disableHttpCaching)
        Disables/Enables caching of data inside the cache of the (external/cascaded) HTTP proxy server.
        Parameters:
        disableHttpCaching - if true, all requests to the (external/cascaded) HTTP proxy server are sent in such a way that caching at proxy server side is disabled.

      • isDisabledHttpProxyCache

        public boolean isDisabledHttpProxyCache()
        Checks if the cache of the (external/cascaded) HTTP proxy server is disabled.
        Returns:
        true, if the cache of an (external/cascaded) HTTP proxy server is disabled

      • setHttpHost

        public void setHttpHost(java.lang.String httpHost)
        Sets the HTTP proxy server.
        Parameters:
        httpHost - host name or IP address of HTTP proxy server.

      • getHttpHost

        public java.lang.String getHttpHost()
        Gets the HTTP proxy server.
        Returns:
        host name or IF address of HTTP proxy server.

      • setHttpPort

        public void setHttpPort(int httpPort)
        Sets the TCP/IP port of HTTP proxy server.
        Parameters:
        httpPort - TCP/IP port number of HTTP proxy server.

      • getHttpPort

        public int getHttpPort()
        Gets the TCP/IP port of HTTP proxy server.
        Returns:
        TCP/IP port number of HTTP proxy server. A value of -1 means that no port number has been defined.

      • setHttpsHost

        public void setHttpsHost(java.lang.String httpsHost)
        Sets the HTTPS proxy server.
        Parameters:
        httpsHost - host name or IP address of HTTPS proxy server.

        Sets the TCP/IP port of HTTPS proxy server.
        Parameters:
        httpsPort - TCP/IP port number of HTTPS proxy server.

      • getHttpsPort

        public int getHttpsPort()
        Gets the TCP/IP port of HTTPS proxy server.
        Returns:
        TCP/IP port number of HTTPS proxy server. A value of -1 means that no port number has been defined.

      • setAuthUsername

        public void setAuthUsername(java.lang.String authUsername)
        Sets a basic authorisation username.
        Parameters:
        authUsername - basic authorisation username or an empty string if basic authorisation is not needed.

      • getAuthUsername

        public java.lang.String getAuthUsername()
        Gets the basic authorisation username.
        Returns:
        basic authorisation username or an empty string if basic authorisation is not needed.

      • setAuthPassword

        public void setAuthPassword(java.lang.String authPassword)
        Sets a basic authorisation password.
        Parameters:
        authPassword - the authorisation password or an empty string no password is not needed.

      • getAuthPassword

        public java.lang.String getAuthPassword()
        Gets the basic authorisation password.
        Returns:
        basic authorisation password or an empty string no password has been defined.

      • getBase64Auth

        public java.lang.String getBase64Auth()
        Calculates the base64 transformed username:password for basic authorisation against the proxy server.
        Returns:
        the base64 transformed username:password or an empty string if no username and password has been defined.

      • setBase64Auth

        public void setBase64Auth(java.lang.String base64Auth)
        Sets a base64 transformed username:password for basic authorisation against the proxy server.
        Parameters:
        base64Auth - base64 transformed username:password

      • getNoNextProxy

        public java.lang.String getNoNextProxy()
        Returns a list of host or domain names for which the proxy settings must not be applied.
        Returns:
        a list of host or domain names for which the proxy settings must not be applied. The entries are separated by commas or semicolons.

      • setNoNextProxy

        public void setNoNextProxy(java.lang.String noNextProxy)
        Sets a list of host or domain names for which the proxy settings must not be applied.
        Parameters:
        noNextProxy - a list of host or domain names for which the proxy settings must not be applied. The entries must be separated by commas or semicolons.

      • isNoNextProxy

        public boolean isNoNextProxy(java.lang.String hostname)
        Checks if the next proxy configuration must not be applied for a specific host.
        Parameters:
        hostname - host name or IP address which should be checked
        Returns:
        true, if the next proxy configuration must not be applied
